job_title: Registered Nurse, CVICU in San Antonio, TX
pros: Unit has a good range of low to high acuity CVICU patients, but your low acuity CVICU patients will be tripled and coding in the same shift. There was an intensivist in hospital on nights, but frequently unreachable to keep your pt from coding, because they are busy with another code.
cons: Hostile/DANGEROUS work environment, while management, CNO's brush it under the rug. Extremely cliquey. One experienced nurse chased off all excellent RN's with her level of experience to assert her control over staff. Terrible pay, not worth the years of therapy you will need after working in such a hostile; physically, mentally, and emotionally threatening work environment.

pros: Pros of working at Methodist include great coworkers. We all worked as a team and were like a second family. Also, you learn a lot there. Everyone is willing to help and it feels like a good work environment.
cons: Cons of working at Methodist include poor staffing and sometimes inappropriate bed assignments. We usually had only one CNA, sometimes none, so I often found myself doing RN and CNA work for 5-6 patients. It is very hard to satisfy patients when placed in this situation. Also, several times, the charge nurse would tell the house manager that an incoming admit was not appropriate for our floor. The house manager wouldn’t listen, and most of the time in these situations we ended up doing an RRT on the patient and then transferring them to ICU.

job_title: Registered Nurse II in Houston, TX
pros: Any issue presented to our director, she is able to resolve, quickly and painlessly.  She is a master at uniting a very diverse group, and it appears she does it with great ease.. The caring comes from the top on down to the the person who is always smiling even though he has only one functioning  arm to mop the floors.  He never complains but always has a smile for everyone.
cons: The weak link appears to be human resources, who is not humane and not very resourceful.  If it had not been for the wisdom of  my director, and knowing that historically Methodist has been loyal  to their employees who have been loyal to them,  it would be quite easy to move on down the road.

review_title: Not as good as past years
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Gary, IN
pros:
Methodist pays nurses a competitive wage compared to other hospitals in the area. I liked my co-workers of almost 14 years. The hospital is trying to work towards magnate status, so is only hiring RN staff nurses.
'
cons: Management can be shortsighted in the persuit of their goals. Some unit managers expect you to live for the job, as they are not very caring of your rest time away from work. Also it's hard working short staffed, and with equipment that is less than durable. Short supplies are also an issue. Information is also not shared as it should be.

review_title: Great place to build a career if you don't want to have any personal life
pros: Great compensation package, management is supportive of educational growth, many opportunities for career advancement, great facilities, teaching institution in a medical center by several universities, lots of PTO
cons: Management expects too many hours from nurses, hard to take days off when needed, very inflexible with hours and demand overtime.  Good nurses are expected to carry the not just their patient load, but also carry lazy and poor nursing staff.  Management will not counsel/fire bad nurses;  very inconsistant and unequal expectations from staff nurses.  Management needs to manage instead of being afraid of the employees that bark.

job_title: Critical Care RN in Merrillville, IN
pros: Pay is higher than the immediate area and benefits are good.  They have both eight hour and twelve hour shifts.  The patient food services are really very good for a hospital.  Newer nurses can be hired in on days because of the high turnover.
cons: Managers micromanage nurses and let CNAs (union) do next to nothing.  The building is old and needs to be remodeled.  Parking is not the best- lots not well lit or close to the building.

pros: Methodist Hospitals can be a rewarding work environment. Staff are experienced and willing to help outside of there prospective jobs.Employees assigned to Environmental Services take pride in keeping up the cleanliness of the Hospital.
cons: Everyone associated with Methodist should come together as a unit in maintaining a friendly environment for our customers. Sometimes things get out of hand but quickly corrected our customers shouldn't witness an disturbing issues amongst the employees.

pros: Pay is comparable for the area, if the hours are as described in your interview.
cons: Hired as 1.0FTE.  Yet,  my "manager" cannot schedule me for 40 hours? Have to fight to get 32 hours weekly. Manager told to pay myself with my PTO to make up the difference.

review_title: I absolutely LOVE my patients, but I HATE that the patient care has become a business!!
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Merrillville, IN
pros: We are the ONLY hospital in northwest indiana area that will treat and or care for those will no insurance!!!
cons: Just like the other hospitals in the area.....Methodist is losing their focus! The want to become a BUSINESS instead of a PATIENT centered care hospital!!

pros: GREAT people to work with, the opportunity to serve a grossly under served community and have a very real impact on people's lives day to day. Decent pay and benefits.
cons: Micro-management, lack of advancement opportunities, lack of ongoing training and education, lack of resources overall at the bedside.

pros: The patients and cohesiveness of some of the staff.
cons: Short staff with patients really needing support without the help they need. One CNA to 16 patients and nurses pushing patients to dialysis because they do not have enough transportation. Nurses are mandated to go to HCAPS meeting and leave their patients just to find out what changes they can make as a entire entity but no coverage for their patients. Equipment is old and dangerous with no upper management to listen.

review_title: Terrible and such a drag. I
pros: Benefits and compensation package was great, opportunities for advancement were great as well. Training for the company is great as well.
cons: The work flow is not evenly distributed. Department often works short-handed as well. It seems like many revisions needs to be made to this hospital.

review_title: Methodist is a nice place to work
pros: Management is helpful and very understanding in most department.  They are very family oriented and the benefits are average for the area.
cons: We are overworked due to very low staffing levels in order to keep overheads low.  As a safety net hospitals we treat all patients no matter their ability to pay.
